law.catch_line: Issuance of second or joint executions.
law.text: If an execution against property is issued and the plaintiff desires to take out another at his own cost, the clerk may issue it although the previous execution has not been returned. If the execution is returned in whole or in part not satisfied, a new one may issue. On a joint judgment against several persons the execution must be joint.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1652.
